page.title: 16NORTON CHURCH.
page.content: Before Norton's 'modern church' there was a previous wooden church built before the Norman Conquest.But the actual church (St James The Great) is believed to have been started by the Normans around 1080.The walls are built of thick,local stone, some 13 feet wide. The bell tower has 3 bells in it dating from 1450 to 1716.In 1925 the bells had their clappers replaced and the original ones are now on display in the church. The church although small caters for the village needs quite well. The church and its grounds are used for many different things apart from services such as Fetes,Social meetings and Sunday school.The church also has its own choir. Many other events take place in the Parish Hall which is in another part of Norton.
